IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: St. Madeleine's serves more than 400 people with developmental disabilities. Our mission is to educate and empower individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities to realize their full potential. Students participate in one of the following programs depending on their level of ability.
IRS990.MissionDesc: St. Madeleine's serves more than 400 people with developmental disabilities. Our mission is to educate and empower individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities to realize their full potential. Students participate in one of the following programs depending on their level of ability.
IRS990.Desc: Our Activity Center program allows each individual with developmental disabilities to achieve their personal potential through a structured and enriched vocational training program in campus and community-based settings. Activity Center participants receive personalized and progressive instruction, which is evidenced in work related experiences and individually tailored goals, objectives and daily activities.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: The Adult Development program offers a variety of opportunities, which aim at increasing the level of independence, as well as improving the overall quality of life for adults with developmental disabilities. A focus is on the development and maintenance of functional skills required for community integration, work training and self care. Clients will typically be in the community 10 to 14 hours per week.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Behavior Modification program is specially designed for clients with higher level behavioral challenges. The goal is to increase the individuals level of independence, and decrease their level of negative behaviors, while they are involved in work and other meaningful activities. The program requires a 1 to 3 ratio. Once a client is able to successfully meet the goals identified in his or her Behavior/Individual Service Plan, they are encouraged to transition to one of our less restrictive programs. The Supported Employment Program provides quality employment services including job coaching for individual and group placements and career counseling. It offers a variety of vocational services to individuals with disabilities who are committed to pursuing work on a regular and on-going basis. The focus of the program is to assist individuals in attaining and maintaining competitive employment.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Center is a public charity and is exempt from income taxes under Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code and Section 23701(d) of the California Revenue and Taxation Code. The Center believes that it has appropriate support for any tax positions taken, and as such, does not have any uncertain tax positions that are material to the financial statements. The Center is not a private foundation. The Centers Return of Organization Exempt from Income Tax for the years ended December 31, 2021, 2020, 2019 and 2018 are subject to examination by the Internal Revenue Service and State taxing authorities, generally three to four years after the returns were filed.

OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 4: Behavior Modification program is specially designed for clients with higher level behavioral challenges. The goal is to increase the individuals level of independence, and decrease their level of negative behaviors, while they are involved in work and other meaningful activities. The program requires a 1 to 3 ratio. Once a client is able to successfully meet the goals identified in his or her Behavior/Individual Service Plan, they are encouraged to transition to one of our less restrictive programs. The Supported Employment Program provides quality employment services including job coaching for individual and group placements and career counseling. It offers a variety of vocational services to individuals with disabilities who are committed to pursuing work on a regular and on-going basis. The focus of the program is to assist individuals in attaining and maintaining competitive employment.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 1a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Actions by committee members are approved by the board of directors.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Sharon Esche Irving has a sister attending St Madeleine Sophie's Center. Susan Bobbitt Voth (Strategic Planning Committee) has a daughter attending St Madeleine Sophie's Center. Rory Goldberg and Melvin Goldberg (Finance Committee) are married. Ginger Poutous (Development Committee) has a son that is attending St Madeleine Sophie's Center. Robbin Kulek Lockie (Treasurer) has a son attending St Madeleine Sophie's Center. Barbara Thunder-Barns (Development Committee) has a sister attending St. Madeleine Sophie's Center. Sean Mercadante (Development Committee) has a son that attends St Madeleine.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The CEO reviews the return and submits the return to the finance committee first for approval. All Board members are than provided a copy for review and it is discussed at a board meeting for approval. Members unable to attend are required to approve the return via email. The accountant is available to answer any questions regarding the return. Based on the approval of the finance committee and the full board, the president or the CEO will sign the return for filing.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: All board members are asked to disclose any potential conflict of interest. The organization has established procedures the board and committees follow if there is a conflict of interest.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The board approves the salary for the CEO based on review of comparable salaries in the San Diego County area.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: There are no paid board members other than the CEO whose salary is reviewed by the board annually. A special committee is appointed to review comparable salaries to determine if the compensation amount and potential increase are reasonable based on similar organizations. Manager salaries are approved by the board during the budget process.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization makes its governing documents, conflict of interest policy and financial statements available to the public upon request.
